sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a metal supplier or online chemical store. Er: Obtain from rare earth metal suppliers or specialty retailers. Mo: Available at metal supply stores or online. Ru: Source from precious metal suppliers or specialty chemical vendors.
steps: Co: Purchase from a metal supplier or online chemical store. Er: Obtain from rare earth metal suppliers or specialty retailers. Mo: Available at metal supply stores or online. Ru: Source from precious metal suppliers or specialty chemical vendors.

1. Weigh out 12.5 g of cobalt (Co). 2. Weigh 25 g of erbium (Er). 3. Weigh 6.25 g of molybdenum (Mo). 4. Weigh 25 g of ruthenium (Ru). 5. Mix the powders thoroughly in a clean, dry container using a spatula or mixer for at least 10 minutes to achieve uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 12.5 g of cobalt (Co). 2. Weigh 25 g of erbium (Er). 3. Weigh 6.25 g of molybdenum (Mo). 4. Weigh 25 g of ruthenium (Ru). 5. Mix the powders thoroughly in a clean, dry container using a spatula or mixer for at least 10 minutes to achieve uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C (2192°F) at a rate of 10°C/min and maintain for 2 hours to allow for complete melting and homogenization of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C (2192°F) at a rate of 10°C/min and maintain for 2 hours to allow for complete melting and homogenization of the materials.

steps: 1. Gradually cool the crucible to room temperature over a period of 3 hours to avoid thermal shock. 2. Once cooled, remove the solidified material from the crucible.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Gradually cool the crucible to room temperature over a period of 3 hours to avoid thermal shock. 2. Once cooled, remove the solidified material from the crucible.

steps: 1. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the specified dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 2. Sand the edges and surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper (e.g., 400 grit) to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample to the specified dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 2. Sand the edges and surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper (e.g., 400 grit) to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability.
